risk_description: Mobile Operating Systems (iOS/Android) frequently kill background processes for battery optimization, threatening the reliability of the Technician 'Travel Mode' location tracking feature which requires continuous updates.
root_cause: Aggressive native OS battery optimization strategies and strict background permission policies in modern Android and iOS versions.
mitigation_strategy: Implement a 'heartbeat' mechanism and utilize foreground services/persistent notifications for Android. For iOS, configure 'Always' location permissions and significant change location services. Use a robust native module wrapper (e.g., react-native-background-geolocation) rather than building from scratch.
contingency_plan: Implement a fallback mechanism where the app prompts the technician to reopen the app if background tracking ceases, utilizing push notifications to wake the device/user.
monitoring_trigger: Gap in GPS coordinate timestamps exceeding 5 minutes for an active 'Travel Mode' session in telemetry logs.

risk_description: Offline data synchronization conflicts occurring when a Technician modifies job status offline (WatermelonDB) while a Service Center Admin modifies the same ticket online, leading to data inconsistency.
root_cause: Dual-write scenarios in a distributed system with disconnected mobile clients relying on local SQLite/WatermelonDB storage.
mitigation_strategy: Design a specific 'Conflict Resolution Strategy' (e.g., Field-level Last-Write-Wins or server-side merging logic) within the SyncManager. Implement optimistic UI updates with rollback capabilities.
contingency_plan: Force a manual resolution workflow in the Admin Portal if the system detects unresolvable version conflicts during sync.
monitoring_trigger: Sync error rate metric > 1% in Application Insights for the mobile synchronization endpoint.

risk_description: PostGIS spatial queries for Service Center routing may degrade in performance as the number of polygons and service requests scales, breaching the <200ms latency requirement.
root_cause: Complex geometric calculations (ST_Contains/ST_Intersects) on unoptimized indexes or large datasets.
mitigation_strategy: Enforce GIST indexing on all geometry columns. Implement Redis caching for frequently accessed Service Areas. Offload heavy read operations to PostgreSQL Read Replicas.
contingency_plan: Simplify polygon geometries (reduce vertices) or fallback to a simpler radius-based or postal-code lookup if latency spikes.
monitoring_trigger: P95 latency for '/routing/match' endpoint exceeding 150ms in performance tests.

risk_description: Azure AD B2C custom policy configuration complexity may delay the implementation of RBAC and specific user flows (Technician vs Consumer), impacting the auth timeline.
root_cause: Azure AD B2C custom policies (Identity Experience Framework) have a steep learning curve and are XML-based, making debugging and implementation time-consuming.
mitigation_strategy: Assign a senior engineer with specific Identity/B2C experience. Prototype the token claims structure immediately. Use 'User Flows' where possible before resorting to 'Custom Policies'.
contingency_plan: Temporarily implement a local auth service for development velocity while the B2C integration is finalized in parallel.
monitoring_trigger: Authentication sprint tasks incomplete by end of Sprint 1.

risk_description: Distributed transaction failures across microservices (e.g., Service Request creation requiring User, Product, and Notification updates) may leave the system in an inconsistent state.
root_cause: Microservices architecture lacking a robust distributed transaction coordinator or Saga pattern implementation.
mitigation_strategy: Implement the Saga Pattern using BullMQ for compensating transactions. Ensure all event consumers are idempotent to handle message redelivery safely.
contingency_plan: Develop a reconciliation script/job that runs nightly to identify and fix orphaned or inconsistent records across services.
monitoring_trigger: Alerts on Dead Letter Queue (DLQ) depth > 0 in Azure Service Bus.

risk_description: WCAG 2.1 Level AA accessibility compliance may be missed in complex interactive components (e.g., Mapbox integration), leading to rework and compliance violations.
root_cause: Canvas-based map libraries (Mapbox GL JS) are notoriously difficult to make fully keyboard and screen-reader accessible.
mitigation_strategy: Build a sidebar or list view alternative for map data interaction. Integrate 'axe-core' into the CI/CD pipeline (WI-OPS-001) for automated accessibility linting.
contingency_plan: Engage an external accessibility audit vendor early in the design phase to validate the map interaction patterns.
monitoring_trigger: Axe linter reporting 'Critical' or 'Serious' violations in the nightly build.
